Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body. The filling-hole is surrounded by a flat rim with a raised outer edge. The nozzle is round in section and has a raised rim around the wick-hole. On the left side is an unpierced lug, with a circular depression on the underside. The base-ring has concentric mouldings within. The upper side is covered with a dark red-brown slip, with runs below.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q540.bis)
